title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: took about a month to hear anything then 2 week interview process with 3 interviews, 2 initial phone screenings then a zoom interview with multiple managers in which they asked scenario questions
Interview Questions: Tell us about your healthcare experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: There was first an interview with the PI over the phone with a few basic questions about the position, then an interview with team members over webex delving into what is expected, projects, and diversty + equity. Relatively communicative throughout.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 Years

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Met with professor via video call followed by unpaid visit to the lab (which required travel). Messages were exchanged via email only. I’d assume this varies depending on who you’re looking to work with.
Interview Questions: Describe your past research experience? Are you willing to relocate?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with the person who was in charge of the small department that was hiring. She was very nice. The interview was casual as it was just the first interview. I enjoyed hearing about the department and the role. The questions were mostly conversational and not entirely formulaic.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your last role.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly standard. I had to reach out multiple times to see if I made it to the next round, and was surprised to learn that I did based on the length of time between rounds. This specific role had 4 interview rounds which seemed excessive for a position that made less than $50,000
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Why do you want to work at OHSU? Have you handled confidential material before?

title: PGY2 Pharmacy Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: submission of the LOR, LOI, and CV to express interest, then the institution offers you the interview. the interview is made up of multiple parts including speaking to PRD, RPC, and clinical preceptors, and evaluating your clinical knowledge. then the match process
Interview Questions: why OHSU? area of clinical interest

title: Technical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process. It was straightforward, standard, and relevant to the work I would be doing. Final interview was primarily focused on explaining what I would be doing and the project the team was working on.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews over a period of time, Scenario analysis, behavior and technical skills with different group of individuals in various teams that the individual in this position would interact with.
Interview Questions: Describe solution to a scenario.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions:
Webex online interview with talent manager. 
Follow up interview with panel second webex online interview. 
Follow up interview in person with panel 3rd
Casual walk around and tour interview 4th
Interview Questions:
How do you keep yourself organized?  
How would you train a person?

title: Coding Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back. The interviewers were nice.  I interviewed years ago for a position. Unfortunately, both times I’ve interviewed, I haven’t heard from the interviewers that they selected another candidate, even after reaching out. They have somewhat poor communication on that front.
Interview Questions: How did I solve an issue at my current job?

title: Audio Visual Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Table of 12 people, anxious stressful. Too many different people talking at once. I couldn't keep up with the words. And the word count on this website . Seriously why am I still having to type in words right now.
Interview Questions: Lots, various, tricky. I couldn't keep up

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview panel consisted of five to six nurses from different units. Interview was conducted over a video call. Make sure to figure out how to use WebEx 1-2 days prior to the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you saw someone do something they weren't suppose to and how did you handle it

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for the OR. Got an email to schedule an interview about a week later. They wanted me to come in person so I did. Was a panel interview of about 5-6 White ladies. I felt odd being a minority. Was asked about 5 behavioral questions. Interview was about 40 mins long. I felt like they were professional but also a but rude. They had follow up questions for most of my answers. Clearly this hospital was not a good fit. They don’t care about you or your well being as an individual. Not only that, but I felt like there was no diversity in their unit even though OHSU claims diversity as one of its core values… kind of a joke.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you wanted to give up in nursing school. Describe a time you had a patient that had a change of condition. Describe a time you didn’t agree with some else’s practice. Describe a situation in which you gave a handoff. Describe a time when you had a difficult patient.

title: Contracts Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers had very little understanding of the role and the more senior of the interviewers, who was more removed from the role, unfortunately dominated the conversation. When I was called back for a second interview, I was told by the assistant to the SWOG Chair that I had to meet with him in a matter of hours as that was the only time he was available. I explained that I currently had a full-time job and could not take off with such little notice for the second interview-- effectively declining the job.
Interview Questions: Are you good with handling a high volume of contracts?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with resume and transcript then brief phone call talking about what my interest in working there was. This was the entire process. Was only for a summer job.
Interview Questions: Subjects studied, past projects, past research

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with a screener from a rehab manager followed by an in person interview for a described outpatient position at the clinic itself with mix of management and clinicians.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Initial email with interview options, live interview.  Panel interview with direct managers.  Set questions, open ended; situational and behavioral.  Social distanced. Comfortable and personable group. Received verbal offer same day.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you were up against a lot of tasks and how you managed your time?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview after an hour interview on the phone. They had  5 people in a zoom call and another person on the phone.  I thought the interview went well even though it was 1.25 hours long.  I was not offered the position and I asked for feedback regarding my interview. The feedback I received  was i was "slightly" unprofessional because I could not answer some of the questions right away, too much "umm" - specifically the question below.  They also mention that I took the interview too "lightly", I was smiling too much. I felt that the feedback was directed to my personality not about my knowledge and work ethic. Then the last comment in the email mentioned that I was professional for reaching out and asking for feedback.
Interview Questions: What is the risk they would have in hiring me.

title: Specimen Processing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly quick, depending on who you interview with. The only thing I wish was different was how they describe the job and what the training period would be like.
Interview Questions: How do you handle high stress situations in a work environment?

title: Claims Examiner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with someone on the phone to set up interview. I then had a phone interview where she asked questions regarding my past work experiences and what I could bring to the table.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: I had my interview with the pharmacy staff. There were about 8 staff members there and would filter in when they  were available.  The staff would take turns asking questions they if had any. It was a new experience for me, but I really enjoyed meeting everyone since I would end up getting the position. It was just nerve wrecking being in the hot seat, but everyone was so nice.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress, and how would your teammate be able to tell if you're stressed?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Delayed communication from application to interview. After verbal offer , gap of six weeks before offer letter in writing arrived. Interview with leadership team with a normal length of about thirty minutes for interview.
Interview Questions: Organizations mission and vision for hospital

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: very laid back and felt no pressure. It felt like I was just having a regular conversation. The interview took about 45 mins and it was over before I knew it
Interview Questions: tell us about a challenge and how you overcame it

title: Assistant Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position and initial contact was with hiring director. Additional set of interviews were set up via WebEx. For the most part, typical interview questions. Did not care for the way the interview with the staff was handled. Staff came in/out of room with computer logged into WebEx. Could not see staff and did not know who was asking the questions. Internal candidates were interviewing as well, so I have no way of knowing if they were in my interview! Staff asked numerous questions about handling assault, violent patients, and administrative discharges. If I would have been offered position, would have clarified why so many questions in this area.
Interview Questions: Would you be comfortable administratively discharging a patient? How do you handle physically abusive patients?

title: GME Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4+ months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Online panel interviews with 3-4 people, multiple interviews. Final interviews in early January. No updates or response to clarification emails after Jan 14. Finally withdrew application after extensive wait time and lack of communications with candidate.
Interview Questions: General questions regarding why the candidate was interested in OHSU, what skills they have to offer, behavioral questions, etc.

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Friendly panel interview. They asked quite a few questions. Be prepared to discuss specific examples of clinical experiences (delegation, safety, leadership, etc). Know the organizations values, why you are the best person for the position you want, and have good questions to ask them as well.
Interview Questions: Describe how you feel about working with CNAs?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very stressful. Lots of behavioural questions that relate to how you've made decisions as a student nurse in the past. Ex: Tell us about a time you had a difficult patient and how you gave care.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you received constructive criticism.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Amazing! Such kind people. The company is great too. Really made the hiring process easy and seamless. Communication from HR is reliable as well.  Made everything go that much smoother.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for this role?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: I have done many interviews with various reputable hospitals across the country but I am sad to say OHSU has so far been THE WORST hospital when it comes to the hiring process. They are slow, they are inconsiderate and above all disrespectful of applicants' time. Unless you have all the time and patience in the world and don't mind getting your dignity and respect trampled on by staff, I would not recommend applying here.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself. 
Why are you interested in this particular position?
What are you looking for in this job that your current job is not giving you?

title: Nursing Student Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: it was a group interview. Each applicant was asked a question in a category.  There were 3 managers interviewing. Questions were focused on social justice, diversity and equity, and were all situation based questions, where you provide examples of how you acted or what you said in that situation. For example "tell us about a time when..."
Interview Questions: Who is someone you look up to?

title: ICU Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions:
Questions that are asked during the interview are designed to see how you would respond to a specific/certain situations.

Only one interview. From the initial interview to the offer is about 2-3 weeks apart.
Interview Questions: Give me a time where you had to handle a difficult situation with a coworker? How did you handle it?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions:
Simple process after the application process. 1. Written answers to questions 2. Phone screening 3. Panel interview 

Questions asked specific questions about management and philosophy. Phone screening with multiple people was average.
Interview Questions: What unique skills and experiences will help you excel at this position.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and heard from the hiring manager not too long after the posting closed. The initial phone interview seemed to go well, they asked the usual questions. A few days later the hiring manager contacted me again, this time to schedule a panel interview. This also went well with no surprises for the interview questions. The hiring manager said their choice would need to go through a number of approvals and that I would know their decision in 2-3 weeks. It has now been over 8 weeks and I have heard nothing. I emailed the hiring manager for an update after 6 weeks and received no response.  I assume they offered the position to someone else, so I guess in a way their radio silence gives me my answer... but ghosting candidates is a pretty unprofessional way to go about it. At least let candidates know they were not selected.
Interview Questions: Please describe how your experience, skills and knowledge relate to this position.

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by hiring manager within a week of applying online.  Initial video meeting with hiring manager went really well. Hiring manager setup 2 panel interviews.  The first panel interview was with 7 people and they asked me pretty standard questions for 1.5 hours.  Then the 2nd panel interview was with 4 people and that also seemed to go well.  Within 2 days of the last interview, received an email invitation to complete a self assessment and to have 5 references be provided via the automatic email survey system.  All references were completed within a couple days.  It's now been almost a month with no follow-up.  Online it said that my application was still under review.
Interview Questions: Describe an inner join versus an outer join.

title: Social Work Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The interviewers were very friendly and professional, we started with introductions, then went straight to the description of the  job. After that they asked questions
and then they let me ask questions.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 5 years
What is a strength you have
Are you familiar with Neuroscience and Disabilities 
How do you

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Hillsboro, OR) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, on time, general questions, and background. Future goals, where do you see yourself in the next five years. collaboration questions, handling a situation, exp with sponsors, vendors, departments.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward and productive. On the video conference with a few other people. Communication was great and productive. People were very kind and responsive. Over all, very well done and appreciated.
Interview Questions: It was a video interview

title: Senior Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: there were three steps of interview process. initially I had a meeting with the core committee. And later gave an open seminar and finally within 3 days the offer me the position.
Interview Questions: What is your future goal? They also ask me about my specific experience in the area of interest. AND finally, they asked that how I could tackle the current task here.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: In person, good communication leading up. With both the assistant manager and manager. Afterwards a unit tour with option to shadow a current nurse. Chose to do the shadow and had an opportunity to participate in a mock code.
Interview Questions: Goals, experience, situations  and how you handled them

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Consists of few significant team member from unit lasting around 30 minutes virtually with general behavioral interview questions and your experiences as a particular specialty you are applying for .
Interview Questions: Describe situation when you had to work with difficult coworker closely?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: They will ask technical questions about various science technology commonly used in lab, such as what reagents are included in a PCR and how to do simple math calculations. They will give rejections and acceptances very soon after an interview.
Interview Questions: What is in a PCR reaction.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: it was easy just make sure you have references because they will go off that and be ready to answer some questions on your second interview.  it easy just have great responded and you will get in the door
Interview Questions: why you want work here

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview via video with the nurse managers and various staff. They were nice, some more than others. They mostly asked behavioral questions. Still waiting for an offer from them.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you want to work at OHSU.

title: PAS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: It was just the initial interview that lasted about 30 minutes. Asking about relate-able experience to the job. How much experience and why I wanted the position. To questions about mistakes I made and what I learned from them.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: The interview consists of a panel of 6 interviewers. Each interviewed introduced themselves and asked a question that was scenario-based. I was given the opportunity to ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you developed a creative care plan for your patient?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: I heard back within a few days to set up an interview, set up an interview a week later, and then took a few weeks to hear back. The interview was by video with two people and lasted about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when someone gave you negative feedback.

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied and contacted by manager within 1 week to set up interview. Panel interview with manager and 2 other members of the team. Questions were fair and related to team work, collaboration, and steps to dealing with coworkers. Took about 6 weeks from application to post closing and resolution.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a coworker who disagrees with you or continually makes the same mistakes?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: She called me once to set up a time for a phone interview that was to take a 20-minutes and consist of three questions. She called, asked the three questions, and ended the interview.
Interview Questions:
Name a weakness and a situation where you dealt with?
Name a strength and where it was highlighted?
Name 3 of your strengths at work.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Hiring manager reached out first for phone interview, followed by two panel interviews. COVID accommodations with both interviews occurring with OHSUs distance platform. I recommend testing the link and all wifi prior to interview
Interview Questions: Questions about management style, career growth, and why the job interested me.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is two steps. First, you have a phone, then an interview with a committee over their zoom system. It is efficient and they are all very kind.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had an issue with a co-worker and how you handled it.

title: Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Group interview style. Sit in with three different interviewer. Group of 4-5 interviewers. They have a set number of questions. Each person goes one at a time answering a different question each. Everyone answers the same questions but in different orders.
Interview Questions: What do you do if someone was dishonest?

title: Medical Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy and quick. They let you know asap and are very pleasant to interview with. Happy with the experience and very pleased with the outcome. They are very professional and let you take time with the questions
Interview Questions: What are some strengths of your work ethic?

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a phone interview followed by on-sites. Onsite was a dinner with past fellows. The next day was a full day interview rotating with various leaders throughout the organization. Expect behavior, situational and mild case questions
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this organization

title: Assistant Staff Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: 1. Zoom interview with division director; 2. Talk with every division members in groups (about 4 groups, 45 mins each); 3. Job talk; 4. Discuss job details; 5. Discuss offer; 6. Reference check
Interview Questions: What do you feel about our group?

title: Property Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: interview was fairly simple, with questions more so related to coworker conduct and a small portion of it consisting of relative work experience. be prepared to study the afscme hourly wages so you arent given below starting pay, as this department tends to actively forget what is within the union guidelines. union is generally free providing one signs their name in the charter, but a 15$ a paycheck stipend can be deducted upon electing so.
Interview Questions:
- Have you ever driven a 24ft truck?
- Are you comfortable with using technology with work?
- Can you lift 50lbs?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews, two days apart. The interviewer wanted to do interviews the same day she contacted me. I wanted to appear flexible so I agreed. I thought the interviews went well. I never heard anything back one way or another which was disappointing. I wrote a follow-up e-mail which wasn't responded to.
Interview Questions:
How do you do with children?
Do you work well with difficult people?

title: Research Assistant 2 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly people and the process was fairly easy. A phone interview/screening at the beginning and then a video interview with the PI and the research coordinator. Everyone was very responsive to phone and email.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about yourself? How well do you work under pressure?

title: Research Assisatant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Found the listing on a job site, was contacted a couple weeks after I applied to fill out a written Q&A. Spent the next month doing video call interviews (maybe 3) and was then asked for my references. Was contacted about 2 weeks after that with an offer.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

Tell us about your work experience.

Many communication focused questions.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Well setup. Two to three people panel. Phone terrier first then in person. 5 to 10 questions about background. Lots of tell me about a time you were in blank situation. Phone interview last about 20 minutes. And in person last about 30 minutes. They do show you are the work space.
Interview Questions: How long have you been a tech?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview via online video app webex. I did not get the position because they chose someone from within the hospital system. Manager was very friendly and helpful in providing positive feedback.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you teamed with patient or family to change care plan

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Oregon City, OR) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers introduced their department and what they were doing.  Questions following self-introduction were mostly about the experiences and behavioral questions. Also talked about the career plan and answered basic statistical questions.
Interview Questions: How do you interpret p-values to a clinical doctor?

title: Research Assistant 2 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Lots of questions about experimental procedures and very few “typical” interview questions (strengths, weaknesses, etc). The majority of the interview was spent discussing previous research experience and the results of past research studies that I have been a part of.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with PCR?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on the OHSU website. I was emailed by the manager to set up a phone interview. I had a phone interview with the manager and then was asked to come in for an interview with the manager and team leads. After this interview I was asked to come in and interview with the rest of the team.
Interview Questions:
When was a time you made a mistake and how did you deal with/ correct it?

When was a time you had a conflict and how did you handle it?

What do you do to manage stress?

How do you keep yourself organized?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: First a brief phone interview with very generic interview questions. (What is your best strength ect) then in person interview was with about 5 different research teams. I learned a lot about each research group and had opportunities to ask a lot of questions. Then the final person asked very specific research related questions.
Interview Questions: Very specific questions about programming and science.

title: RN for the Transition to Practice Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: 4 person panel interview. Spent about 50 minutes answering questions and then was provided information about the next steps of the interviewing process, which involved a call letting me know I had moved on in the selection process and a request for references .
Interview Questions: tell us about a time you made a decision using your independent and dependent scope of practice

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Process took about 4 months. Applied in October, interview in November and rejected in January. Interviewed with the 14A General Surgery unit. The assistant nurse manager was technologically incompetent, addressed the emails to me by the wrong name, failed to send me directions to the interview when requested and did not respond to call, page or email. During the interview, she accused me of lying about not receiving directions. Since the interview, she has sent me not one but TWO emails addressed to an RN with the same first name regarding a narcotic discrepancy. The second email contained a patient medical record number, birth date and first/last name. I reminded her to check the email address before she sent an email to that employee again and if a third breach occurs, I will be filing a formal complaint.
Interview Questions: What unit/specialty was your senior practicum and how many hours did you complete on this unit?

title: Computer User Support Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: You'll first be contacted via email to schedule a 15-30 min phone interview. Once that is complete you will receive another email to let you know they would like to meet face to face. The face to face was with a panel of two people.
Interview Questions: Q: How would you handle a difficult situation with a provider and how comfortable are you with navigating those situations?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an online application, which included job specific questions and uploaded my resume and cover letter. I was contacted by phone to schedule an interview. I had a panel interview with representatives of the department.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: PAs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: First Panel interview was with two supervisors and then 6 others from the department join in. Second for the Hiring HR team they reached out to get more information to get the paper work rolling.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you would handle stressful circumstances. Such as an angry patient on the line.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for RN residency program. Was called to schedule interview about a week after applying. Interview seemed very laid back. Management was friendly. Did not hear back for several weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe a creative care plan you came up with and the patient outcome.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Efficient and friendly. The PI was informative and the postdocs that conducted the majority of the interview asked creative and thoughtful questions. It was about an hour overall. Most of it was with the postdocs, while probably 15% was with the PI.
Interview Questions: What experience did I have? What was my favorite and least favorite thing about my last position?

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Process started with an 30 minute interview with the lab PI, which was followed by a tour of the lab space and ended with brief individual interviews with the lab managers.
Interview Questions: Have you worked in a medical office setting before?

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Short process, fairly easy questions. Interviewers were friendly though panel (6 interviewers) was intimidating. HR required a reference from my current manager which was uncomfortable without an offer in hand.
Interview Questions: Asked about previous experience. Behavioral questions.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I have been asked many questions about work, behavior, quick adjustment. How can I handle a high volume of patients? A conflict with a co-worker. Time and willingness to stay or work overtime as needed.
Interview Questions: How do I handle a conflict with my co-worker?

title: Dietetic Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: First talked about OHSU and then daily life of the dietetic technician. Then got asked some questions (mainly behavioral) and asked the interviewer some questions. I interviewed with a total of three people.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to prioritize.

title: Transportation Aid Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: A few days after applying they called me to set up an interview for the following week. I was interviewed by two different people. After the interview, they emailed me to ask for my references, and about a week later they called to offer me the job.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to have good listening skills.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Poor communication about expectations for daily responsibilities. Phone interview by HR with no context. First round interview with management fine, but generic and dispassionate. Second round of interviews with prospective coworkers was  the only real opportunity to determine work culture. Compensation hilariously opaque
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Pharmacy Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, called next day for a phone interview. Got an email a few days later regarding an onsite interview.  Was asked to present a project that I had led in the past.
Interview Questions: Do your values match the values of our company?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very nice, friendly atmosphere. This was pre-covid so I went in person, not sure if they do virtual interviews now. They asked about some previous employers, how my college was going (I was still an undergraduate), and they gave me a wonderful tour of the office. They had me meet the principle investigators, who where great and knew of some professors of mine.
Interview Questions:
What was my experience in psych research so far? 
What peaked my interest in this specialty?
What do I plan to do in the future in this field? How would I use this experience to future these goals?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview competed over the phone, traditional questions but must include specific examples. Prepare for follow up questions and clarification on answered. They like to dive into your questions to seek more Information.
Interview Questions: Dependent and independent scope of nursing, dealing with difficult patients and coworkers

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Full day on-site interview. Did a presentation on PhD work. Back-to-back individual meetings for the rest of the day.  Spent most of the time learning the projects in the lab.
Interview Questions: What is the career plan? Where do you see yourself in five years’ time?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very slow and very unorganized. Originally, they concluded the first interview by letting me know that  be contacting me by the end of the week with a final decision. However, they ended up scheduling a second interview, which they canceled hours before and did not reschedule until the following week.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel you want to work with a vulnerable population of people?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panelist interview with 5 individuals. They asked 7-10 questions and left door open for conversation. We’re pleasant and easy to talk to about all concerns and things regarding the program
Interview Questions: Why this program? Why pediatrics?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, called the next day for a phone interview, was immediately offered a video interview for the following week.  Phone screen was about 15 minutes long. Pretty standard questions about my senior practicum experience.
Interview Questions: What type of patients did you see in your senior practicum?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online at the OSHU website, it was simple and easy to apply. I got an email to schedule a phone interview, the phone interview went well. My interviewer spent the first half giving a better description of the job, the facilities and projects they were working on then went on to the interview questions. She asked for letter of references from three people and said they would schedule in person interview in a few weeks for those decided to move on with. Thats as far as I got.
Interview Questions: Whats your greatest accomplishment?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received an email the next day to confirm a phone interview. Had a phone interview the same week and was invited to interview with a panel in 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at OHSU? Why this unit?

title: Resesrch Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Multi level overly too o many interviews. Leadership missed my first meeting and then scheduled 2 follow ups. Was weird setup around schedule but ended up working out and I took the job
Interview Questions: What are your Technical skills

title: Patient Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter shortly after applying and asked a few questions. I was later notified that I had been selected for another interview. The interview was a phone interview with two people asking me questions.
Interview Questions: What experience from your history makes you a good fit for this job?

title: Oncology Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the assistant nurse manager via email to set up a phone interview with her and the nurse manager. The interview was only 30 minutes or so and I only had to do a phone interview which was really nice.  I didn't have any technical nursing questions, all the questions were behavior and experience based. The whole process from submitting my online application to getting a firm offer from HR took a month (beginning of Jan to beginning of Feb 2019).  My start date was about two weeks after the date I received my firm offer.  My case may be unique because the unit that hired me is expanding so the nurse manager is hiring a lot of nurses and training of all these nurses needs to get underway so that the unit is prepared for the new expansion. Overall, a very good and speedy hiring experience.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your communication style?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Application through the general web, emailed with ooen interview times, and then confirmation email was sent. The process did not take long if you have a insider.  I did get a call first prior to scheduling a face to face interview.
Interview Questions: It was along the lines of, tell us a time where you used creative care planning?

title: Outpatient Billing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was typical of a large hospital. You apply through their portal and wait for an email from somebody in HR or the hiring manager to schedule an interview with you.
Interview Questions:
They were you standard interview questions such as "tell me about a time when you had to deal with ambiguity" or 
"...deal with a difficult situation". There was also a team lead interview.

title: Field Service Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: The entire process is very impersonal. You must take a written quiz first then a hands on test demonstrating help desk phone skills, hardware assembly skills, mac and windows troubleshooting skill. if you pass all that you will be given a final panel interview of around 10 people
Interview Questions: describe a situation where you were tasked a problem that you did not know the answer to a solution and how you managed to deal with it

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online to the general talent pool. Was given a phone interview. Then my resume was sent to the clinics i expressed interest in. I was called by each of these clinics to schedule an interview. Able to schedule interview fairly quickly. After the interviews, I was called to give a verbal offer.
Interview Questions: What would be your biggest challenge? What do you do with a conflict between a coworker? How do you respond to high stress environment? What is a weakness of yours? What is a strength? How would you deal with a coworker acting in an unsafe manner with a patient?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone screen and then was called in for interview. When I arrived it was clear that they already had selected a person for this role and were just going through the process. A waste of my time.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had to give negative feedback to an employee?

title: HR/Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth and unusually short- within a month. First, I was contacted by email and then phone. Came in for a panel interview. Followed up with 2 phone calls asking for references and then an offer, along with some additional emails for clarification purposes.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of how you managed a stressful situation.

title: Senior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The entire process took about 5 weeks from the phone screen to a polite rejection note about a job dealing with research data curation for internal clients.  

There were 5 people in the room interviewing me for a clinical research analyst role, and other than their current job titles there was nothing to indicate from their backgrounds that any of them had any direct clinical experience - nor did they ask about mine.  The work unit was very interested in getting somebody in with Epic certifications; however, nobody in the room would have had any prior to starting their roles.  It also didn't sound like the type of place that allowed for the honor of a sponsored certificate (the only way to get an Epic certificate) to be bestowed upon anybody that didn't already have one.  One of the interviewers seemed anxious and fearful, kept questioning my credentials with regard to working with data, though the questions revealed more about her own lack of expertise with programming in general.  There was a distinct emphasis on rote memorization over anything to do with problem-solving.  

Despite the original allure of what seemed to be a potentially interesting, well-funded position supporting clinical research, it felt very much like a typical tech job interviewing experience.  I felt like I was expected to possess extremely specific skills walking through the door, though there was probably no room for growth/training once you made it in.
Interview Questions: So what would you do if somebody requested a particular piece of data from Epic, without much direction?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Not very formal. Questions are relevant yet lengthy. The clinic manager asked the questions not the back office supervisor in charge of the medical assistants. There doesn't seem to be a good screening process, this shown in their poor decision hiring medical assistants and keeping them. If management cleans up their act and rids the bad apples, this place would function appropriately.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of mistake you made and how you resolved it.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online on a Friday and they contacted me the next Monday about setting up a phone interview. Phone interview was the following week, followed by an in-person interview the week after that. Heard back from management the following week.
Interview Questions: All "tell me a time when...." questions

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Many behavioral interview questions. I interviewed for a few positions with OHSU and just didn't like the atmosphere. Everything was very impersonal. They didn't seem to care about me a person, just my nursing skill set. Ultimately, I took a position with a different hospital.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a liability to OHSU?

title: Anesthesia Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I received a  phone call from the hiring manager about a day or two after I applied online, and  was asked to come in for an in-person interview.  It was a panel of two people, and the interview was pretty straightforward.  Fun fact - I actually had this exact same interview 4 years previously with the same hiring manager, but I totally bombed it (was soaking wet cause I fell in the rain, showed up 5 mins late....).  The interview process was exactly the same in 2018 as it was in 2014.  It kind of seemed like they already knew which candidate they were going to hire by time they got to me.
Interview Questions: The questions were pretty regular.  Things like, "Tell me about a time that you had a difficult patient", "tell me about a time that you made a mistake," and questions about operating under stress, etc.  They were reading all of the questions from a printed out sheet.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with lab hiring manager, large emphasis placed on past experience, followed up with PI and lab hiring mangers via phone. No fly out necessary. Fairly relaxed process.
Interview Questions: What laboratory techniques are you most familiar with?

title: Transportation Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied on Monday evening, got a call for an interview on Tuesday evening, and had my interview on Friday of the same week. I got an Email on Monday the following week asking for references. They are very fast and don't blink or you may miss something. 2 people were in my interview. They barely made eye contact because they were writing down what I was saying that whole time. Nice people. Excited for employment.
Interview Questions: What are two things you would say to start a conversation with a patient?

title: New Graduate RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a over the phone interview, followed by a panel interview. The whole process was fairly laid back. They asked standard questions like how to deal with interpersonal conflict, as well as senario questions related to the department,
Interview Questions:
How have you felt with difficult situations involving a co-worker in the past?
What is your communncation style?

title: Transport Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Friendly interviewers, easy to answer questions as long as you've worked in the position or done your research prior to the interview, dressed nicely, and shown that you are friendly and will be a good fit.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse - Operating Room Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted in a timely fashion.  Set up a phone call and then a video interview.  Drug test, background check, reference check.  Interview questions were standard.  Worked in an operating room before this one so they were catered to operating room nursing.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at OHSU in the operating room?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were conducted online via video chat for the first round of interviews and lasted 15 minutes. The second round of interviews were in person. One of the current research assistants who had been working on the project interviewed me first, and asked general questions to see if I had the qualifications and proper work environment to perform my job effectively.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself.

title: HR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was scheduled for a phone interview and they never called. I waited two weeks for this interview and arranged my schedule around it. I could have emailed afterward to follow-up and see if there was a problem, but I didn't because it was very unprofessional of them to not at least email me beforehand if they had made a change to their interview list or schedule.
Interview Questions: Wish I had been asked one

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was stretched out over a number if days which could be very impractical for people who work full time. . It was very intensive. I had the opportunity to meet a great number of employees and Providers.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work at OHSU?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: I met with two managers. They asked the basic questions and then asked me learn and demonstrate a short and easy research task. They were both very pleasant and I felt very comfortable. At the end of the interview I asked them about my strength as a candidate and they were impressed and encouraging.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Senior Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Thee were several interviews.  Some on the phone some in person.  Had to interview with multiple sites. Had one on one interviews then panel interviews.  Quite extensive but left not knowing how it went
Interview Questions: A lot of questions about the systems I have built in the past

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied on company site, was called 3 months later, had a short phone interview and was asked to come in person. We had a short 15-20 minute interview, and I was called 3 days later and informed I had been selected for the job.
Interview Questions: Describe an example of a time you had a conflict with a co-worker and how you worked through it?

title: Information Security Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It's a large and somewhat fractionated company that after being recently compromised has decided to start staffing the IT department more appropriately. They rely on outsourced IT recruitment for applicants and while the process can take time, approximately 1-2 month, they do try to get back to you with some type of response. The onus is on the Applicant to check as to where in the process the decision is, so that can make things a bit stressful if you are relying on a quick answer to plan your career move. They prefer local versus out-of the area applicant. The IT team (i.e.: the working class) is very congenial and friendly, accepting of variety any ideas and love to interact with the new Applicants. The VIP and Management are more isolated, focus on memorization of knowledge and a grasp on a variety of subject matter as opposed to personality, work ethic and the obvious - intelligence. This is an indication that management is not in touch with the real world nor with their employees and hence I am willing to bet that decisions reflect those ideas. The general staff is very accommodating and truly respectful of the process and make every effort to accommodate all the needs during the interview process.
Interview Questions: What is our mission statement? How would you handle a non-solvable conflict? If left alone in office with access to a computer, how would you exploit it? What is Change Management? Describe HTTPs and how it is used? What is the difference between HTTPS and SSL? Tell us about yourself? How do you handle conflicts? What is your opinion on the various past viruses and why? How do you harden a system? How to you elevate permissions?

title: Patient Access Specialist (Front Desk Reception) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed initially on the phone. The first interview lasted about 15-20 min because I had already interviewed with the same manager for a previous position which I had totally blown so I didn't make it to the 2nd round. She said that she would be finishing her phone interviews by the end of the week and would contact those she would like to interview in person by next week. To my surprise I received an email from her the next morning stating that she would like to schedule an in person interview with her and some of the practice managers that I would be working with. The second interview was scheduled a week and a half later. It was with one practice manager and the original hiring manager in the spine center. The interview was very professional (as I had already had another in person interview at OHSU that was not conducted very professionally l) and I was asked traditional interview questions such as how do I handle difficult situations and could I give an example of a time that I had to deal with a difficult coworker etc. I had answers to all those types of questions readily since I have always worked and interacted with the general public for my jobs. I was thanked for coming in. I sent a courtesy thank you email right after my interview and within 30 min had a response from the hiring manager saying she would like to contact my references if that was permissible. The next day I received an email request for me to input my references so they could be emailed with a survey. The whole process took about 30 min and they had requested 5 references. I input 7. 4 from current of former employers and 2 from current coworkers. Within 24 hours I had all references respond and I immediately received a job offer email! I was even able to ask for a later start date to allow my current employer time to find my replacement and get them trained as well as already had a trip booked to Utah. They were very accommodating which is already a great sign within the dept!
Interview Questions: Give us an example of a difficult coworker and how did you respond?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The application process at OHSU starts with their horrible job search site. It is very outdated, doesn't work properly with all web browers or Apple devices. I had a 30-minute phone screening, it was a little rushed, but all questions were asked. First ten minutes where about the job and procedure. The next steps after a phone screening were two different panel interviews. 

I received positive reviews, but they decided to move forward with an internal candidate.
Interview Questions: Can you give me examples of difficult customer service situations and how you handled them?

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Long but appreciate the opportunity to meet many players including staff interview 
Allowed me to learn the culture & how collaborative everyone is to support this role.
Very organized and kept me informed of the entire process along with providing an escort between interviews
Interview Questions: The usual

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: My first interview was with a Leadership panel, followed by a second interview with  panel of direct reports from the department. Skills test was administered to verify professional writing capabilities.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were standard for a leadership position. There were many questions related to motivational fit and experience with personnel management.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: They ask many technical nursing questions relating to the care population you are interviewing for. They tend to bring up their nursing model as well. I got quite a few questions on time management and how to deal with interpersonal conflict and feedback. Mostly just normal interview topics though.
Interview Questions: How Roukes model of nursing influences my practice

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received an email for a phone interview a couple weeks later. Phone interview was very casual and about 30 minutes. Was told about the job, asked about my previous experience, and was able to ask questions about the position.
Interview Questions: What is your previous experience?

title: Transportation Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were very nice but their questions were off, and kind of impossible to give an answer to. They would ask questions, seemly looking for a very specific answer but I had no idea what that was.
Interview Questions: What ways did you alter treatment plans at your job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The nurse manager took me through the emergency department to show me it's features. She then took me back to her office where we talked about the upsides and downsides to the job. Most of the interview was spent with her describing to job to me.
Interview Questions: The only question I was asked was "Give me the 60 second rundown on your life up until his point," or something to that effect.

title: Food Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: phone interview and a 30 minute interview with the two managers that I would be working with. it was a very easy interview. good good good good good good good
Interview Questions: food temps

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I received an email requesting a phone interview within a couple days. The phone interview was with an HR representative, which was incredibly positive not only because I received an interview offer, but she was very friendly and personable. It made the interview go much smoother. This was followed by two in-person, on-site interviews, the first of which was with a panel of individuals I'd be working with regularly. They asked questions round-robin style and allowed ample time for questions. In the final interview, I met with 4-5 people in their own, individual time slots. This time, it was various members of the executive management. Each in-person meeting lasted approximately an hour.
Interview Questions: Many of the questions related to my work style, why I wanted to work in this field, and they required plenty of examples of projects I'd handled in past.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Process went very quickly.  Submitted to HR but hiring manager called me directly and did a phone interview.  Moved on to 2nd interview  in which I had a 1x1 interview with the manager, panel interview with team mates, and panel interview with other department representatives.
Interview Questions: How do you handle ambiguity?

title: Senior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very swift and efficient, with scheduling for the interview, reference checks, and offer all occurring in a few days time. The interview panel were helpful in describing the goals and needs for the project. Unfortunately, the job title and salary range was posted incorrectly. I was offered the position but sadly could not accept based on the low salary offer. Next time I will be sure to clarify the title and salary range upfront in the interview. The interview panel was very apologetic and offered to work with HR on improving the transparency of the available salary in the future.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I appreciated that the department kept the interview process moving quickly. I was first contacted for a brief phone interview where they explained the job and responsibilities. The following day I was emailed with an invitation to interview in-person where I met with 2 hiring managers and a CRC. A couple days later I was asked to come in again and meet the research team to see if it would be a good fit. The following week I was offered the position. Overall it was a very nice experience and the managers didn't ask any traditional interview questions, and instead wanted to learn more about me and my personality and goals.
Interview Questions: What was your biggest failure in your work experience and what did you learn from it?

title: Student Research Assistant/Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The Hiring Manager called after a week to schedule a phone interview 2 days later. A week after that was the in-person interview and then a week after that was the call about the offer. The lady was very polite and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions:
1. What are 3 things you can offer?
2. What are your expectations from a manager?
3. Why do you want this job?
4. Briefly summarize your research experience.
5. Describe a time when you worked independently
6. How do you multitask?

title: Human Resources Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: First, there was a phone interview and I talked to two individuals. If you pass the phone interview,  then you will have a  panel interview with 6 or more people. They will then determine if you will be a potential fit in their company.
Interview Questions: Job specific duties that you have performed that relate to the job you are applying for

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview is via phone. Next step is an in-person panel interview. If they are interested past the interview moving forward with references and the hiring process. Part of the hiring process includes a full background check and credit check due to the fiscal responsibility of the position.
Interview Questions: Within a workday how do you prioritize tasks and indicate which ones are the most important to start with?

title: PAS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Process took about 3 weeks from online submission to job offer. Conducted 2 interviews (one hour each). First interview was with managers. Second interview was by other PAS Specialist. NOT an easy interview! But was asked very good questions. It was a great experience.
Interview Questions: If your boss told you to do something that was against policy, would you do it?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Met directly with the laboratory's principal investigator. Details about the research were discussed in scientific detail. Was asked a question relating to my understanding of the concepts being explained during the interview which were related to the research.
Interview Questions: Was asked a question relating to my understanding of the concepts being explained during the interview which were related to the research.

title: CRISP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was extremely brief. The woman who interviewed me seemed to be in a rush the entire time. She did most of the talking, explaining and going over the expectations for the position and the program. She asked me to talk a little bit about myself and my background but never asked me any other direct interview questions. I think that the most important part of the interview process is the lengthy application they have you initially fill out.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your educational and research/clinical experience 
What are your future goals

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: My I initial interview took place with our professional practice leader and my unit manager, they were both very excited to meet me and have me join the team. After my interview I was offered the job that same day and started soon after shadowing day shift then night shift nurses.
Interview Questions: Tricky question: what does the Oregon board of nursing define as nurse specific interventions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Process began with an exclusive email from PI after word of mouth job search, then a phone interview followed quickly by a in-lab interview with PI and Lab Manager. Lab interview had a quick skills check as well as a lab meet and greet.
Interview Questions: Why our lab?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Three week total process. Emailed by Hiring Manger to conduct a 15 min phone interview for more information regarding the position. Was offered a two part in-person interview: First, with Hiring Manager and Financial Assistant; second, Marketing director that collaborates with department. Was notified the following week regarding possible offer for position.
Interview Questions:
What has been your favorite job?
What are you most proud of in your work experience? 
What do you bring to this position? 
Where do you want to take this position if offered the job? 
What would you seek to accomplish in your first 3 months?

title: CRA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview was followed by a group interview. Mostly questions related to past work experiences and work expectations. Stress on team work and soft skills. I was the job within the same week.
