Interview Questions: Telephone interview was followed by a group interview. Mostly questions related to past work experiences and work expectations. Stress on team work and soft skills. I was the job within the same week.

title: Program Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
They performed a phone interview, followed by an in-person interview.  The in-person meeting was in a warehouse office, where no door was specified.  When I arrived, I used an outside phone to ask to be let in.  I was directed to another door, where I was to phone again.  When I phoned again - at the second door - the interviewer (who said she'd wait for my call) did not pick up.  Needed to call three times before she answered.  No explanation or apology was offered.

Walking through their offices was grim.  Their office space was dim and quiet, the cubicles small, and everyone looked unhappy.  No one returned my smiled hello.  Clearly not a positive environment.

There was only one interviewer, because the second interviewer was "called away".  She gave me the impression that this interview was a formality, as if it didn't matter whether the other interviewer was present.
Interview Questions:
The interview ~ about ten questions ~ was about how I handled difficulty and disappointment.  How I handled conflict; How I handled not meeting management expectations;  How I delivered bad news to managers;  What did I do when I could not meet all management expectations; etc.

It appeared they were looking for someone good at damage control - which didn't bode well for whoever they hired.  Based on the questions, the interviewer's attitude, and the office setting, it's a safe bet the internal culture at OHSU must be pretty punishing.

title: PAS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very professional and informative. The building was impressive and welcoming.  They stayed in contact with me throughout the pre-interview and interview process. It was easy to get to the interview location and everyone I met seemed happy in their jobs. There were two people interviewing me and both seemed to enjoy their jobs.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Senior Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied in May and heard back one month later for a phone screen. One week after phone screen, I had an in-person with the hiring manager  One week after that, I was asked to complete an in-person with the head of the department I was applying for along with two potential coworkers. A reference check and personality test was requested afterwards with writing samples. I was informed a few weeks later that I was not offered the position.
Interview Questions: No specific questions, everything was structured like a casual conversation about my experience in the field.

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Beaverton, OR) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Application online, including references and cover letter. Emailed directly by PI, first interview over the phone, second interview in person with PI and lab members. The phone interview was one-on-one with the PI for about 45 min, as an introduction and explanation of the position. The in person interview was a series of one-on-one and group interviews, each lasting about 30 min, for a total of about 2.5 hours. Additional phone interview as an quick update/check-in. All interviews were more of a conversation than a formal question and answer session. Entire process was fast and friendly.
Interview Questions: They asked about my background, research experience, and familiarity with lab techniques.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online (OHSU has an awful careers site that is un-intuitive and difficult to maneuver) and received an email within a couple days from the PI who posted the job.  We arranged a phone interview, and concluded it by agreed to schedule a follow-up interview that would include a presentation.  Then I never heard from the PI again, as they did not respond to any of my follow up emails about the next interview.
Interview Questions: How has your research experience prepared you for this position?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the primary investigator and sent in my resume, cover letter, and transcript. Then I was called in to meet with with the PI, and two senior research associates that were heading each of the respective projects I was working on. Everyone was very friendly, and obliged me by describing each of the projects in depth. The only negative is that it has taken quite a while to hear back.
Interview Questions: What molecular techniques are you familiar with?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application online on April 17th. Called by the nurse manager 1 hour later, set up a phone interview for April 22nd (I live in Ohio). The nurse manager and a charge nurse put me on speakerphone and it lasted about an hour. The 1 hour later the nurse manager called and offered me the job. Fantastic experience!
Interview Questions: Tell me three specific things your coworkers would say about you.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by an in person interview with two people in the department. One of the questions in the interview flagged for me that it would not be a good fit. They were looking for someone long term and I am looking for a position that will offer growth in the future. I was asked to come in for another interview with the department head and declined, sharing my career goals as an explanation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, nurse manager called for interview and asked several questions before they would interview me. They agreed to interview me and said I was a 'good candidate'.  That process was positive. At the actual interview, there was only the nurse manager. The manager kept on focusing on their MAGNET status and how they were a high risk unit and that they train the physicians going out into the community, which is expected for a university hospital. There was no focus on the actual job or the nursing team. The manager was rude during questioning and did not seem interested while asking questions. When the interview ended the manager told me that I was the last interview and they were "glad that the interviews were over." I expected more out of the face of that nursing unit and was disappointed in OHSU.
Interview Questions: What benefits and risks are there to me for hiring you and what benefits and risks are there to you for hiring me?

title: Staff Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-line through their website. Received an acknowledgement in my mailbox. A few weeks later was contacted by the laboratory for an interview. We agreed upon a time and a place to meet. This was a 1x1 interview directly with the person who was offering the position.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know whether I would be able to perform specific experiments, interpret data, and write up conclusions.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Two total interviews. One phone interview and an in-person interview. It was a group/panel interview, consisting of about 6-7 people who interviewed me in a one hour sitting. They will ask you questions one after another, while writing notes down on your resume.
Interview Questions: Was asked about confidential information and how I would handle having access to this sensitive information. Also basic interview questions such as your greatest weaknesses, strengths, why you would like to work for the company, how can you improve the position, and what you hope to accomplish in your first 3 months of work if hired.

title: Assistant Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very low key.  I met with two research coordinators and they described the position, what my job duties would include, and the expectations of the company.  I was asked a variety of basic interview questions.  The interview process went really well and I was notified extremely quickly to inform me that I earned the job.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Career Services In Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Online application, phone screening with HR, one-on-one interview with hiring manager, panel interview with entire group with 15-min presentation, follow-up interview with HR director.  While the process was long, it was logical and there were no surprises.  The presentation was related to the work the person in the role would be doing, so was a good screening tool.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you were not able to get someone to agree/follow you

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had already had a phone interview with them in the past for a similar position, this time when I applied again they called me in directly for an on-site interview. It was a casual kind of interview, I was shown around the office and then the interviewer sat down with me to ask general questions about my background and items on my resume.
Interview Questions: If I have familiarity with MS Access

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: OHSU flew me up after a phone call with the recruiter and then hiring manager.  It was an all day interview with about 20 different people.  Found out day after of results
Interview Questions: What is your experience with lean six sigma?

title: Senior Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied and it took about a month to get an interview.  This was surprising as I have applied for other opportunities at OHSU and their job board "status" has NOTHING to do with the real process.  The status stays "active application" during all interviews and nothing changes until the position is filled.  Right now, I am waiting to hear about the results of my interview.  
I rode the bus to my interview as parking is nuts on the hill.  I was surprised at the lack of upkeep on the facility I interviewed in.  Very old building, needed maintenance on the brick steps, a power-wash and de-mossing badly.  

I was greeted by an admin to the dean, she was very nice and welcoming.  The interview was late starting and was with 2 members of the faculty.  Good conversation.  Still waiting to hear on follow up.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you had one-on-one contact/mentoring/supervision with a trainee and the outcome didn't go well.

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted documents, received a call from someone in HR who asked me general screening-type questions then was invited to interview with the hiring manager. I also interviewed with the staff during a group interview.
Interview Questions: Questions were standard.

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: The process is through online submission that is forwarded to the department via HR. There was one day interview and an evaluation of technical skills required for the job. Certain requirements must be met such as certifications. They then notify you of the selection within a reasonable time.
Interview Questions: With such a narrow skill, the questions were straight forward without any curveballs.

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Process to get an interview was incredibly cumbersome and time consuming.  Perhaps that was due to the department that I was dealing with?  However, it seems to take that big of an organization quite a while to decide and then to proceed with finally pulling the trigger and hiring the correct candidate.  The infrastructure seems very cumbersome, but the people are amazing.  Once onsite however, the interviews and interviewers were amazing.  What a terrific organization.
Interview Questions: "Why did you leave your former position?" Only because it was an acrimonious split. The other questions were thought provoking and genuine, not just canned. They seek to know you level of knowledge and adjust accordingly.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very laidback, just met with faculty in the department and asked questions about their research. Make sure you have a good idea of who you'd like to work under and try to impress them / show you are motivated.
Interview Questions: They will ask you about your research and interests. Also some of them asked what you were hoping to get out of grad school

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume to posting on OHSU website.   Received a phone call from the hiring manager to set up one on one interview.   Interview at set time and shown around the clinic and discussed next steps.   Received call from manager with an offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for OHSU?

title: MRI Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Following a 90-minute in-person interview with two members of department leadership, and a tour of the department, I was told "You'll definitely be hearing from us." After several weeks passed with no word, I contacted the recruiter, and was told that the position had been filled without anyone bothering to notify me. I had expected more from OHSU; but now I don't know why.
Interview Questions: Two basic technical questions regarding the specific field of work for which I was applying.

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial phone interview and was invited to have one on one interviews with each of the Physicians that I would be working closely with as their Research Assistant. The process was much more relaxed than I anticipated. Both of the physicians were warm and friendly and actually seemed genuinely interested in my responses. I've had less positive experiences where the interviewer seemed bored or I got grilled with technical questions. This process was more like seeing if our goals met.
Interview Questions: There were a couple questions that could be difficult if you aren't a person that thinks long term. "Where do you see yourself in five years?" "What are your career goals?" "If x doesn't work out, what will you do?"

title: Psychology Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Very structured. Communications were adequate. Interviewing with several different faculty members. Each faculty had a different approach. Each had a very distinctly different personality. There was appropriate separate area for interviewees to gather. However, a lengthy amount of time occurred for which there was no contact with interviewees and left them amongst each other allowing for unprofessional interactions, which was left unchecked.
Interview Questions: If you could pull any toy from your childhood into the present, what would it be

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied through E-mails. Seminar about the research i did previously. Questions were from the seminars. Interviewed with all the people in the lab. The process took a day. Then the decision was made the second day.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose here

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was brutal. I was an internal applicant and went through 3 panel interviews (about 5 - 6 people per interview), plus 3 additional rounds of interviews with physicians and higher level leadership. It was a very stressful process.
Interview Questions: What do you think were the biggest mistakes in the history of this department?

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by email to set up a brief phone interview.  Phone interview was relaxed and lasted about 15 minutes.  Then I went and toured the facilities and met with the head of the lab and another member of the lab where they spent most of the time explaining the job position, but also asked me interview type questions.
Interview Questions: Do you want to go to grad school or any other further schooling?

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and after 2 weeks I received an invite for an interview. The interview was with the PI and  lasted ~1 hour. We talked mostly about my past undergrad research experience, a bit about his research, and what the job entailed. After waiting a week, I was told a more experienced candidate was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Nothing was unexpected. Be prepared to talk about your past experiences.

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online as required for the position, then they contacted me for an interview. It was to be a position for the South Operating Rooms. I met 2 senior anesthesia technicians, and they were both very friendly. I got to see some of the South OR, which was a huge area of the OHSU Hospital on the Marquam Hill Campus.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a co-worker wasn't pulling his or her own weight at the job?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, thorough, professional. Gave me a real opportunity to feel the environment out. I didn't know if I wanted the job until I met the team. Met with people from multiple departments and had a chance to see how people interacted with each other.
Interview Questions: Why did I want the job

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was smooth and quick since i initial started as a Research assistant
Interview Questions: There were not difficult questions. The

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University
Interview Descriptions: These vary depending on the supervisor and the department. The online job system seemed simple to use and the results to job queries came within a week or two. It's not perfect, as HR is charged with the initial screening, but pretty good.
Interview Questions: None really. Basic interview; I suspect a bit of vetting came before the final interview.

title: Project Team Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, didn't hear from anyone for month & half, had phone interview, then 1:1 interview, then panel interview with about 15 people (they told me it would only be a couple of people that would be interviewing me), they told me they'd call me in a week-2 weeks went by and on week 3 they offered me the position,
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Lab Technical Assistant/OHSU Blood Bank Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: After applying online I didn't hear anything for over 2 weeks. I e-mailed the hiring manager directly to see if they had made any decisions for the position. She e-mailed me back saying that they'd like an interview, which was scheduled for the following week. The interview itself was very straightforward, mostly a check to see if I had the required schooling and experience based on the HR-prescribed minimums. After the interview, I didn't hear anything from the hiring manager for over 2 weeks. I tracked her down and asked her in-person if they had made a decision, at which time she took me to her office and offered me the position. All-in-all, very unprofessional and disorganized.
Interview Questions: The interview was as standard as possible, nothing stood out as unusual.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Initial phase of application is completely automated. Your cover letter and resume MUST match the search terms from the job description.
Phone interview to elaborate on what you submitted.
In-person meeting to learn more about the position and how your experience matches their needs.
Interviewing manager was very articulate and sharp. Come prepared.
Interview Questions: What would you do in the first few months to be as effective as possible?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Be persistent. Your application may be lost. It sometimes takes 6 months to get interview. Helps to know someone who works there.
Interview Questions: None. Standard. Very routine.

title: PAS Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Typically, one phone screening interview, then one in-person panel interview (I was internally hired for this position). Prior to being hired at OHSU, the manager of the department I applied for had contacted me after HR forwarded my application and resume to her.
Interview Questions: Any question wherein they would ask you how you would handle a particular situation on the job. It varies between departments and clinics, and oftentimes, they give you the "worst case scenario" at its absolute "worst" to see what you'd say.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a 1 day interview where I met with many faculty in the department and gave a seminar talk.  During the seminar the faculty asked many questions.  I also met with students and postdocs and they quizzed me on my research as well.
Interview Questions: What was your previous research?  What research are you interested in doing here?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and the HR person emailed me about the position.  We had a phone interview and then she set up another phone interview for me to talk to the supervisor and the main person I would be working with (I lived long distance).  The phone interview was fairly easy and then I set up an in-person interview.  They didn't pay for the flight or relocation expenses or anything.  The in-person interview was also fairly easy but I was very qualified for the job, so I don't know if that had anything to do with it.
Interview Questions: Honestly, I can't think of anything.  They pretty much just asked me questions right off of the job description.

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: My first interview was held via skype since I was located in another state. I appreciate the opportunity to meet my prospective employers face to face without having to deal with a costly short trip across the country. The interviewers were flexible with their times and availability and the interview process still felt professional.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your previous experiences do working with cancer survivors and older adult communities

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
This is for OHSU in Portland Oregon.

Hiring managers will vary and are the immediate supervisors in my experience; mine weren't up to speed on how to do hiring and ended up calling me months after I applied for the job.  I interviewed for two different jobs at OHSU, both started out with a phone screen and then progressed to in-person interviews.  

Culture on the academic side is pretty casual.  Interview questions are not standard from job to job, so research about the lab or group who is offering the job moreso than overall OHSU company information.  OHSU's website is large and the organizational structure can be confusing to a newbie.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Beaverton, OR) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: This job was for a research assistant position in an OHSU lab that studies the effects of alcohol on primates.  The interview was fairly straight forward.  I was given a tour of the facillity by my interviewer, which was very interesting.  I was also introduced to a range of current employees.  Questions were nothing unexpected.  Essentially, the job wasn't a perfect fit for me because more of my prior research experience related to alcohol use in humans.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I would mind doing some manual labor cleaning cages, etc.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: For a postdoctoral position the interview process was typical. I met the principal investigator first and talked about potential projects, secondly met individually with members of the lab, and third presented a formal job talk to group of invited departmental guests.
Interview Questions: What is your 5 year plan?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was in Michigan back then, my current boss called and talked to me for 15 min, then called my referral and probably talked for another 10 min, and I was hired later that evening. I was hired in March but only started my new job in July due to visa application and yes, they do provide you with H1B visa. If they said they don't, look for another PI.
Interview Questions: What kind of research do you do? Any relevant research skills?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Sent in resume to Human Resources.   Phone interview with Human Resources and then  in person with manager and assistant manager.  Interview with the RN staff, Medical assistant and doctor staff.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: In 2011-2012, I joined a high school program at OHSU called the Partnership for Scientific Inquiry (PSI). By completing this program I was able to secure a summer internship at one of the OHSU labs. I did not have a formal interview for PSI, but I needed to apply through an online application.
Interview Questions: Online Application Q: "Please explain why you want to participate in the PSI class, including what you hope to gain from the experience and why it is important to you. (150-300 words)"

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had two in-person interviews with two different directors, then a third phone interview with another director of a different area. The communication for setting these up was great through the Administrative Assistant. I perceived everyone to be very welcoming and nice.
Interview Questions: What do you think of uncertainty? I wasn't asked the typical interview questions so it was unexpected.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and easy-going discussions about my research and common interests with various faculty, vice chair and chair. I was offered several research options and given ample time to accept their offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: This review is regarding a phone interview only. Following the phone interview I withdrew from consideration. The phone interviewer spent most of the time chuckling about her own experiences and that of the few job duties she would describe. Perhaps she wanted to just get a "feel" for me. I found the interview overall very incomplete, leaving me with many unanswered questions. I stated I had a lot of experience performing one key role. She assumed this to be the case and did not ask me any questions to verify. Always verify. Sometimes people exagerrate in interviews, I don't. Incisive questions need to be asked. I suppose I could have simply gone with the flow, but I am a professional health provider. I wondered how this person got their job.  What kind of environment would I be entering?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: cant remember too much detail. applied online while working at OHSU. 1 phone call to set up interview with both potential supervisors. short interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Cytogenetics Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very fast process in my case. It took them less than two weeks to offer me the job. I was basically hired based on a phone interview!!
Interview Questions: None! Do your STAR technique and you will be fine.

title: Systems Analyst Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: It seems with OHSU that they don't have any "standard" interview process. Mine was conducted almost solely by my manager and it was his own unique questions that I doubt anyone else would receive. I had a 30 minute phone call, 30 minutes in person with my manager, 30 minutes in person with upper management, 15 minutes in person with my manager. Nothing technical but I think that was because my manager didn't know anything technical.
Interview Questions: They asked some questions regarding HIPPAA and PHI.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I had a chance to get in touch with my boss, who was also my postdoctoral advisor at a professional meeting. We had a brief chat there. Then I was invited over at OHSU to give a presentation of my doctoral research as an interview. It went very well. 
The hiring process took a while because of all the background checks and to complete safety training to gain access. But I guess that is normal for many places. Mine took a little longer because I had to wait for me work permit to arrive.
Interview Questions: The questions were about my presentation. I didn't receive a difficult question.

title: Career Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied on indeed, then had to apply directly to OHSU. Had a screen interview by a very low level HR screener, who asked salary requirements. Called back and screened again by dept HR. Contacted for department of 5 interview, then one on one w Dept head. Entire process took approximately 2.5 weeks. Nice folks, easy to relate to . Initial screener was not so good.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Financial Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was working as a temp for them when they were looking to have the Financial Specialist position filled. I worked in the Executive Admin office and hit it off with the staff very well. When my assignment ended I asked if there might be some additional work (translation "I'll do anything to stay on board!!"). A couple of weeks later, I got an e-mail from the associate administrator asking I meet with her to talk about the Financial Specialist position
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: PAS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Took them almost 2 months to get back to me. They schedule you for a phone interview first then if selected they bring you in to do a group panel style interview. On a hiring note, they usually only select OHSU employees for 1st 7days of an opening and have to have a good reason to hire externally. They asked the typical interview questions, team oriented kind. They will try to often you 1 step up from what you're currently making but they're usually no drug test to take unless its for a specific position. The background check it done through a 3rd party service they verifies your wages, dates of employment, etc. Benefits are good...kinda like a HMO because you get the best coverage by using their facilities. High co-pays though $25 each OV, $200 yearly deductible is good.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with drama and gossip?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions:
My telephone interview with the research staff was positive, but I had to pay for an in-person interview trip at my own expense at my "level" (e.g., non-clinician).  Subsequently, I had a positive interview, but the job was offered to another candidate.  I was told I was one of two top candidates and must give references.  Though this somewhat makes sense, I caution against giving references unless you are THE candidate.  Otherwise, it alerts your present employer that you are "looking".  I was then offered another position, but I eventually declined because the salary range at OHSU for my job description was dismally low with no relocation, etc.  There was no negotiation on the salary.

Everyone I interviewed with was wonderful.  I would have LOVED to work with this group.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions asked.

title: Resource Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Asked about my strengths, areas of improvement and times when I had to use team skills.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Beaverton, OR) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied through a program at my school. Questions dealt mostly with any research experience I had or work I did as an undergrad. One phone interview than on site interview.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I got interviewed with invited group of students for 2 days. At first day, I had 3 interview with different professors for 20 min each then had with program committee members over 30 mins. Next day program provided downtown trip.
Interview Questions: How my graduate study can relate to my future goal?

title: Biomedical Engineer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oregon Health & Science University (Portland, OR) in Jun 2007
Interview Descriptions: One on on meeting. A lot of quistions about my background
Interview Questions: Why biomedical engineering?
